health.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the general condition of your body and how healthy you are
health.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I’m worried about my husband’s health.
health.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the work of providing medical services to keep people healthy
health.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The government has promised to spend more on health and education.
health.translation[0].definitions[2].def: when you have no illness or disease
health.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Even if you haven’t got much money, at least you’ve got your health.
When we last met, he was glowing with health  (=was clearly very healthy).
health.translation[0].definitions[3].def: how successful something such as a business, an organization, or a country’s economy is
health.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The monthly trade figures are seen as an indicator of the health of the economy.
health.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Physical exercise is essential to good health.
At the age of 70, her health is excellent.
He wanted to join the army but his health was too poor.
He retired early due to ill health.
Despite failing health, he travelled to Australia to visit his son.
Poverty affects children's physical and mental health.
Her physical health was generally good.
The programme aims to educate teenagers about sexual health.
A balanced diet will improve your general health.
Some chemicals pose a significant risk to human health.
There is no doubt that smoking can seriously damage your health.
Doing more exercise will improve your health.
Her health improved slowly after she came home from hospital.
Many Americans cannot afford even basic health care.
He missed a lot of time at work through health problems.
The report looked at the health risks linked to eating excess sugar.
the health benefits of doing yoga
The study looked at the long-term health effects of drinking alcohol.
the health warning on cigarette packets
Her parents were elderly and in poor health.
Eating plenty of vegetables is good for your health.
Your choice of exercise must depend on your general state of health.
The breakfast program improves the health and well-being of the children.
health.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the business of providing medical services to keep people healthy
health.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Increased resources had been made available for health, housing, and education.
Rentokil specialises in industrial products in the field of public health.
Health inspectors came to check the factory’s canteen.
health.translation[1].definitions[1].def: used to talk about how successful an organization, system, or economy is
health.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: This is a serious threat to the health of Japan’s banking system.
The balance sheet provides a lot of information on the financial health of the company.
health.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a system or an organization gets a clean bill of health, it is said to be in a good financial position after a detailed examination of it has been made
health.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: A meeting of EU finance ministers gave the European exchange-rate mechanism a clean bill of health.
health.translation[1].definitions[3].def: to make an official statement that a product is not harmful or dangerous
health.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Lawyers said the company had something to hide about the drug’s development, but the FDA gave Prozac a clean bill of health.
